data.title: Letters per digit
data.statement:
You will receive a string [[s]] as input. Your job is to calculate the percentage of letters per digit rounded to the nearest integer. 
You can calculate a percentage by doing {{[[x]]*100/[[y]]}}, in your case [[x]] <<being the number of letters>> and [[y]] <<being the number of digits>>.

testCases.title: Say hello to my little friend
Validator 1
testCases.testIn: 1f y0u g0t wr0ng b3 aware 7ha7 spac3s don't c0unt. N31th3r d0 exclamations!

testCases.title: Congrats! I think...
testCases.testIn: D1d y0u get the 1st test right?

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: Y3s, in s0me cas3s the letters may have a lot more occurrences than the digits.

testCases.title: Wow there are a lot of letters!
testCases.testIn: A lot of letters is possible, but there is always 1 digit, at least.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: I mean the division by 0 is impossible, so don't worry because there's always one digit, at l3ast ;)

testCases.title: Wow there are a lot of numbers!
Hmmm there's  a lot of trash here....
Is it a round percentage?
testCases.testIn: S0 d1d y0u r0und the p3rc3ntage or not?

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn: 1 b3t you d1dn't round them, right?

data.constraints: There's always a digit in the string [[s]]
data.stubGenerator:
read S:string(256)
write % of letters per numbers
data.inputDescription: A string [[s]] containing letters, digits and other characters.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You will receive a string s as input. Your job is to calculate the percentage of letters per digit rounded to the nearest integer.
You can calculate a percentage by doing x*100/y, in your case x being the number of letters and y being the number of digits.
Input
A string s containing letters, digits and other characters.
Output
Percentage of letters per digit.
Constraints
There's always a digit in the string s
Example
Input
He11o 3v3ry00n3!
Output
100%
